content.text: Navigate to the Repository page for a project
Repository page loads with folder tree visible
Click the Add Folder button in the folder tree panel
Enter a valid folder name (e.g. Login Tests)
Folder name is accepted in the input field
Optionally add documentation using the rich text editor
Folder is created at the root level and appears in the folder tree
Right-click on an existing folder OR select folder and click Add Folder
Context menu appears with folder options
Add Folder dialog opens with parent folder pre-selected
Enter a folder name (e.g. Positive Tests)
New folder appears as a child of the selected parent folder with proper indentation in the tree view
Rich text editor is focused and ready for input
Add formatted text including: bold italic bullet list numbered list and a link
All formatting is applied correctly in the editor
Edit dialog opens with all formatting preserved and displayed correctly

data.name: Create Folder with Maximum Name Length

content.text: Enter a folder name with 255 characters
Name field accepts the long text or shows character limit
Folder is created successfully OR appropriate validation message is shown if limit exceeded
Enter folder name with special characters (e.g. Tests - API & Integration (v2.0))
Name is accepted in the input field
Folder is created and name displays correctly with all special characters preserved

data.name: Create Folder with Empty Name - Validation

content.text: Leave the folder name field empty
Validation error is displayed indicating folder name is required. Folder is not created.

data.name: Create Folder with Duplicate Name at Same Level

content.text: Click Add Folder button at root level
Enter Test Folder as the name (same as existing folder)
Either folder is created (if duplicates allowed) OR validation error prevents duplicate names at same level

data.name: Create Folder with Same Name at Different Levels

content.text: Add a subfolder named Smoke Tests
Enter Smoke Tests as the name
Subfolder is created successfully since it is at a different hierarchy level than the root-level Smoke Tests
Right-click on an existing folder OR click the folder menu icon
Change the folder name to a new value
New name is entered in the field
Folder name is updated in the tree view. Any references to this folder (breadcrumbs etc.) show the new name.
Select a folder with existing documentation
Edit dialog opens with current documentation displayed
Changes are visible in the editor
Dialog closes and changes are saved
Close and reopen the edit modal
Documentation changes are persisted and displayed correctly
Confirm the deletion in the confirmation dialog
Folder is removed from the tree view (soft delete)
Right-click on a folder containing test cases
Warning is displayed about the test cases that will be affected
User must confirm before deletion proceeds. Test cases are either moved or soft-deleted with the folder.
Right-click on a parent folder with nested subfolders
Review the confirmation message showing affected items
Message shows count of affected subfolders and test cases
Parent folder and all nested subfolders/test cases are soft-deleted. Items no longer appear in tree view.
Click Cancel in the confirmation dialog
Dialog closes and folder remains in the tree view unchanged
Locate a collapsed folder with subfolders (indicated by expand icon)
Collapsed folder with expand icon is visible
Folder expands to show all immediate child folders. Expand icon changes to collapse icon.
Locate an expanded folder showing subfolders
Expanded folder with visible children is found
Subfolders are hidden. Collapse icon changes back to expand icon.

data.name: Select Folder to View Test Cases

content.text: Click on a folder in the tree view
Test cases belonging to the selected folder are displayed in the data table. Folder is visually highlighted as selected.
Navigate to a deeply nested folder (e.g. Root > Parent > Child > Grandchild)
Breadcrumbs show the complete path from root to current folder. Each breadcrumb segment is clickable.

steps.step: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"View a nested folder with breadcrumbs displayed"}]}]}
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Click on a parent folder in the breadcrumb trail"}]}]}
steps.expectedResult: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Navigation occurs to the clicked folder. Test cases for that folder are displayed. Folder tree selection updates accordingly."}]}]}

content.text: Observe folders in the tree view
Folders are displayed with case counts
Compare displayed count with actual test cases in each folder
Each folder shows accurate count of direct test cases. Total count including nested folders may also be shown.
Expand several folders in the tree
Select a folder and view its test cases
Navigate away from the Repository page
Previously expanded folders remain expanded (or reasonable default state is restored)
Select a folder in the tree view
Select a template for the test case
Test case is created and appears in the selected folders case list

data.name: Move Test Case Between Folders via Edit

content.text: Open a test case for editing
Change the folder from Folder A to Folder B
Test case no longer appears in Folder A and now appears in Folder B

data.name: View Test Cases in Selected Folder Only

content.text: Select a parent folder that has both direct test cases and subfolders with test cases
Only test cases directly in the selected folder are shown. Subfolder test cases are not included.

data.name: Sort Test Cases by Order Column

content.text: Select a folder with multiple test cases
Test cases are displayed in the table
Click on the Order column header to sort
Test cases are sorted by their order value. Clicking again reverses the sort order.

data.name: Maintain Test Case Order Within Folder

content.text: Note the current order of test cases in a folder
Add a new test case to the folder
Observe where the new case appears
New case is added with an appropriate order value (either at end or user-specified position)
Select a folder with multiple test cases
Enter a search term that matches some cases
Only matching test cases from the current folder are displayed

data.name: Drag Folder to New Position (Same Level)

content.text: Click and hold on a folder in the tree
Folder is grabbed and drag mode is activated
Drag it to a new position between other folders at the same level
Folder moves to the new position. Order values are recalculated for affected siblings.
Click and hold on a folder
Drag it over another folder (not into the gap between folders)
Target folder highlights indicating it will become parent
Wait for visual indication of nesting
Visual feedback shows folder will be nested
Folder becomes a child of the target folder. Tree hierarchy updates to show new parent-child relationship.
Expand a parent folder to show its subfolders
Click and hold on a subfolder
Drag it to the root level (outside any folder)
Drop indicator shows root level position
Folder is now at root level with no parent. Former parent folder updates its display.

data.name: Drag Test Case to Different Folder

content.text: Select a folder to view its test cases
Click and hold on a test case row
Test case is grabbed for dragging
Drag it to a different folder in the tree view
Release when the folder is highlighted
Test case moves to the target folder. Source folder count decrements and target folder count increments.

data.name: Drag Multiple Test Cases to Folder

content.text: Select multiple test cases using checkboxes or Ctrl+click
Drag the selection to a different folder
Visual indicator shows multiple items being dragged
All selected test cases are moved to the target folder simultaneously

data.name: Drag and Drop Visual Feedback - Valid Target

content.text: Begin dragging a test case or folder
Item is grabbed and drag mode is active
Hover over a valid drop target
Target folder highlights in blue or shows visual indication that drop is allowed

data.name: Drag and Drop Visual Feedback - Invalid Target

content.text: Hover over an invalid target (e.g. trying to drop folder into itself)
Visual indication shows drop is not allowed (red highlight or cursor change)

data.name: Drag and Drop Disabled Without Permission

content.text: Attempt to drag a folder in the tree view
Attempt to drag a test case to a different folder
Drag operation does not initiate or shows indication that operation is not permitted

data.name: Drag and Drop Disabled in Filtered View

content.text: Drag functionality is disabled in non-folder views
Press Escape key OR drag to invalid area
Folder returns to original position. No changes are made.
Click on the View Selector dropdown
Tree view shows folder hierarchy. Test cases displayed based on selected folder.
Left panel shows template names instead of folders. Selecting a template shows all cases using that template.
Left panel shows state categories. Each category shows count. Selecting a state filters to cases in that state.
Left panel shows user names. Selecting a user shows all cases they created.
Two categories shown: Manual and Automated. Counts reflect actual case distribution.
Left panel shows all tags used. Selecting a tag shows cases with that tag.
View options are displayed including custom fields
Select the custom dropdown field (e.g. Priority)
Left panel shows all dropdown values as categories. Cases grouped by their field value.
Apply a search filter in the test case list
Filter is applied and results are filtered
Filter criteria is maintained (or appropriately cleared based on design) when switching folders

steps.step: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Click through each state and count displayed cases"}]}]}
steps.expectedResult: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Displayed count matches actual number of cases shown for each category"}]}]}

data.name: Add Folder Button Visible with Permission

content.text: Look for Add Folder button in the folder tree panel

data.name: Add Folder Button Hidden Without Permission

content.text: Navigate to the Repository page as a user without Add/Edit permission
Button is not visible in the interface

data.name: Add Case Button Visible with Permission
Add Case Button Hidden Without Permission

content.text: Navigate to the Repository page as a user without Add/Edit permission
Button is not visible in the interface

data.name: Edit Folder Option Available with Permission

content.text: Look for Edit option in context menu
Edit option is visible and selectable

data.name: Edit Folder Option Hidden Without Permission

content.text: Right-click on a folder as a user without permission
Look for Edit option in context menu
Edit option is not visible OR context menu does not appear

data.name: Delete Folder Option Requires Delete Permission

content.text: Delete option is not visible or disabled when user only has Add/Edit permission
Browse folders and view test cases
Can navigate folder tree and view test case details
Attempt to find any modification controls
Navigate to empty Repository page without Add/Edit permission
Message indicates repository is empty and directs user to contact admin for content
Select a folder with multiple test cases
Check the checkbox on the first test case
Hold Shift and check another checkbox (or use Ctrl+click)
Multiple test cases are selected. Selection count is displayed.
Select multiple test cases using checkboxes
In the modal select a field to update (e.g. State)
All selected test cases are updated with the new value
Change State to Ready for Review
All selected test cases now show Ready for Review state
Selected tags are added to all selected test cases
Select multiple test cases using checkboxes
Click Delete button (or select from bulk actions)
All selected test cases are soft-deleted and removed from the list
Dialog clearly states 5 test cases will be deleted (or similar)
Changes are made in the form
No changes are applied. Test cases retain their original values.
Select or upload a CSV file with test case data
Map CSV columns to test case fields
Test cases are created in the selected folder with data from CSV
Each CSV column can be mapped to corresponding template field
Upload a CSV with missing required fields
Validation errors are displayed indicating which rows/fields have issues
Upload CSV with some invalid rows
Valid and invalid rows are identified
Choose to proceed with valid rows only
Valid test cases are imported. Invalid rows are skipped with summary.
Select test cases or a folder to export
CSV file is downloaded with selected test case data
Exported file only contains selected columns
Apply filters to show subset of test cases
Only filtered test cases are included in export
Locate the resize handle between tree and case list panels
Drag the handle to the right
Folder tree panel expands. Case list panel shrinks. Resize is smooth.
Drag the resize handle to the left
Folder tree panel collapses to minimum width. May show collapse button instead.
Select a folder with many test cases
Next page of results is shown
Each navigation shows correct set of test cases
Change from default (e.g. 25) to different value (e.g. 50)
Page size updates. More/fewer test cases shown per page accordingly.
Enter a search term that matches some test case names
Press Enter or wait for auto-search
Test case list filters to show only matching cases
Enter a search term that matches no test cases
Empty state message indicates no matching test cases found
Open a test case that has been edited multiple times
Click on History or Versions option
List of versions shown with timestamps and editors
Side-by-side comparison shows differences highlighted (removed in red added in green)
Items marked as isDeleted=true are not visible in any view
Navigate to a repository with 100+ folders
Repository loads within reasonable time (less than 5 seconds). Tree is navigable without lag.
Navigate to Project Settings > Custom Fields
Custom field is created and appears in the list
Dropdown type is selected with options input
Add dropdown options (e.g. Frontend Backend API)
Options are added to the list
Set a default value if desired
Dropdown custom field is created with all options
Enter field name (e.g. Target Release Date)
Enter field name (e.g. Requires Manual Review)
Click Edit on an existing custom field
Edit dialog opens with current values
Modify the field name or options
Changes are saved and reflected in the list
Click Delete on a custom field
Custom field is removed from the list

data.name: Delete Custom Field in Use - Warning

content.text: Click Delete on a custom field that has values in test cases
Review warning about affected test cases
Warning shows count of affected cases
Field is deleted and values are removed from test cases

data.name: Set Custom Field Value on Test Case

content.text: Open a test case for editing

data.name: Filter Test Cases by Text Custom Field

content.text: Select a text custom field as filter criteria
Only test cases with matching text in that field are displayed

data.name: Filter Test Cases by Dropdown Custom Field

content.text: Select a dropdown custom field as filter criteria
Only test cases with selected values are displayed

data.name: Filter Test Cases by Date Custom Field Range

content.text: Select a date custom field as filter criteria
Only test cases with dates in the range are displayed

data.name: Custom Field Appears in Test Case Table

content.text: Custom field column appears in the table with values
Open a test case for editing
Clear or leave empty a required custom field
Validation error is displayed for the required field
Navigate to test case editing or tag management
Type a new tag name in the tag input
New tag is created and applied
Select a color from the color picker
Tag is created with the selected color

data.name: Apply Existing Tag to Test Case

content.text: Open a test case for editing
Select an existing tag from the list
Tag is applied and visible on the test case

data.name: Apply Multiple Tags to Test Case

content.text: Open a test case for editing
All tags are saved and displayed
Open a test case with tags for editing
Tag is no longer associated with the test case

data.name: Filter Test Cases by Single Tag

content.text: Open the filter panel or tag filter
Select a tag to filter by
Only test cases with that tag are displayed

data.name: Filter Test Cases by Multiple Tags (AND)

content.text: Select Tag A and Tag B with AND logic
Only test cases that have both Tag A AND Tag B are displayed

data.name: Filter Test Cases by Multiple Tags (OR)

content.text: Select Tag A and Tag B with OR logic
Multiple tags are selected with OR
Test cases that have Tag A OR Tag B (or both) are displayed
Click in the tag input field
Only tags matching the typed text are shown
Click Edit on an existing tag
Tag name is updated across all test cases using it
Tag color updates everywhere it appears
Tag is deleted and removed from all test cases

data.name: Tags Display in Test Case List

content.text: View test case list with tagged cases
Tags appear as colored badges/chips on each test case row

data.name: Bulk Apply Tags to Test Cases

content.text: Add tags in the tags field
Tags are added to all selected test cases

data.name: Bulk Remove Tags from Test Cases

content.text: Select multiple test cases with tags
Selected tags are removed from all test cases
Tag is applied without typing full name
Open a test case for editing
Click Link Issue or Add Issue button
Enter issue ID or search for issue
Issue link is saved and displayed

data.name: Attach Multiple Issues to Test Case

content.text: Open a test case for editing
Both issues are saved and displayed
Open test case with linked issues

data.name: Navigate to Issue from Test Case

content.text: View a test case with linked issues
New tab/window opens to the external issue tracker
Issue page is displayed in the external system (Jira/GitHub/Azure DevOps)
View a test case with linked issues
Hover over or click preview on an issue
Issue title status assignee and description are shown
Matching issue is found and displayed
Enter search text from issue title
Issues with matching titles are displayed

data.name: Filter Test Cases by Linked Issue

content.text: Only test cases linked to that issue are displayed

data.name: Filter Test Cases with Any Linked Issue

content.text: Only test cases with at least one linked issue are displayed

data.name: Filter Test Cases without Linked Issues

content.text: Only test cases without any linked issues are displayed
View test cases with linked issues
Status badge (Open/In Progress/Closed) is shown alongside issue ID

data.name: Bulk Link Issue to Test Cases

content.text: Link an issue in the issues field
Issue is linked to all selected test cases
Attempt to search for issues while integration is down
Test case editing can continue without issue linking
Open a test case that has been edited
Click on History or Version History option
All versions are listed with version numbers timestamps and editor names
Full test case content as it was at that version is displayed

data.name: Compare Two Versions Side by Side

content.text: Added content shown in green removed in red changed fields highlighted
Click Compare with Previous or similar
Changes from last edit are highlighted
Test case is restored to selected version. New version is created in history.
Each entry shows which fields were modified
Specific changes for that version are visible
Each version shows the user who made the edit
User name/avatar is shown alongside timestamp
Each version shows date and time of edit
Timestamps use appropriate format (relative for recent absolute for older)

data.name: Filter Version History by Date Range

content.text: Only versions within the date range are displayed
Only versions edited by that user are displayed

data.name: Version Created on Test Case Creation

content.text: Version 1 is present showing initial creation
Open an existing test case for editing
New version is added to history
Open version history for a frequently edited test case
All versions are accessible through pagination
Click Create Page or Add Page button
Add content using the rich text editor
Documentation page is created and visible in the documentation tree
Right-click on a documentation folder or select folder
Context menu or folder options appear
Page creation dialog opens with folder pre-selected
Page is created as a child of the selected folder
Folder is created and appears in the documentation tree
Navigate to an existing documentation page
Navigate to an existing documentation page
Click Edit or access page settings
Title is updated in the page and navigation tree
Click Delete or access delete option
Page is removed from documentation tree
Right-click on a folder with pages
Count of pages to be deleted is shown
Folder and all contained pages are deleted
All formatting is preserved and displayed correctly
Click Insert Image or drag image
Image insertion dialog or upload begins
Image is displayed correctly on the saved page
Link is clickable and navigates correctly
Code block displays with syntax highlighting
Table is displayed correctly with content

data.name: Link to Test Case from Documentation

content.text: Search and select a test case
Link to test case is added
Clicking navigates to the test case
Insert link to another documentation page
Clicking navigates to the linked documentation page
Navigate to a deeply nested documentation page
Breadcrumbs show path from root to current page
Matching pages are listed with relevant excerpts
View a documentation page with H1 H2 H3 headings
TOC panel or sidebar shows heading hierarchy
Drag a page to a new position
Page moves to new position in the tree

data.name: Move Documentation Page to Different Folder

content.text: Page is now a child of the target folder
List of versions with timestamps and editors is shown
Open version history for a documentation page
Page content is restored to selected version
No Edit or Delete buttons are visible
Print dialog or export options appear
Page is exported/printed with formatting preserved
Drag a custom field to a new position
Custom field moves to new position
Custom fields appear in the new order
Select which custom fields to include
Configure a custom field with a default value

Field value is copied to current
Only that field is restored other changes preserved
Create documentation page with title Test Setup Guide
Page is saved but not published
Draft pages marked with draft indicator
Draft pages not visible to viewers
Create page with specific content phrase
Search for phrase from page content
Page appears in results based on body content match
Tag is either shared or project-specific per design
Either succeeds or shows limit warning
Try to drag a parent folder into its own child
Error message explains circular reference not allowed

data.name: Folder Path Display in Test Case

Full path shown (e.g. Root > Parent > Child)

data.name: Copy Test Case to Different Folder

content.text: Copy of test case created in target folder original remains
Make changes but do not save
User A opens page for editing
User B attempts to edit same page
Warning shown about User A editing
User B chooses to proceed or wait
Open version history for a test case

content.text: Ensure no folder is selected (click empty area or deselect)
No folder is highlighted as selected

Text appears immediately without needing to click the field first

data.name: New Folder Appears at End of List

content.text: Note existing folders at root level (e.g. Folder A Folder B Folder C)

Ensure the folder is collapsed (if applicable)
Folder shows no expand/collapse indicator or is collapsed

Parent folder automatically expands to reveal the newly created child folder

Drag to position below the last folder (Folder C)
Drop zone below last folder highlights

Folder A moves to the bottom position after Folder C
Order is now Folder B Folder C Folder A

data.name: Expand All Root Folders with Modifier Key

All root-level folders expand to show their immediate children
